title: The two biggest pushers for BREXIT have resigned
body:
Boris Johnson and Nigel Farage, you will not be missed.

The two faces of BREXIT have backed down, David Cameron resigning was nothing but the most graceful political out maneuvering I've ever seen.

I'm curious what'll become of it now, AFAIK the referendum isn't legally binding (i.e. BREXIT doesn't have to happen, it'll just piss off the 52% of the population that voted for it).

Since the United Kingdom is on the verge of no longer being united and the European Union's unity is being tested, I would not be surprised if BREXIT just failed to proceed. Nobody seems willing to push forward with it, who is capable of holding down the fort for the 2+ years it'll take for the UK to leave the EU if not the two men who pushed hardest for it?
